intro: Pilea franquevilleana, commonly known as the velvet plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements, it has become a popular houseplant in recent years.
